text: In today's video, I'll tell you about heading and paragraphs along with that, I'll also tell you about anchor text If you found this course awesome, then do like this video Your likes will help me in getting such free courses In this video, we'll make a small project which will be a bookmark website This bookmark website will help you in getting all your favorite websites together and you'll be able to use it in actual So let's start quickly Write in the comments below, sigma batch OP Let's roll the intro Intro music So guys, as you can see, I'm in my computer screen and if you haven't accessed the playlist yet, then you can do so One more thing I want to tell you is that if you go to github.com or repository then you'll get a GitHub repo of sigma web dev course I've made a folder for all the videos and I've made a commit according to the folder So do access this folder so that you can get the source code I'll also put the source code in the description so there's no problem Now we'll make a very basic website but it'll be very important for us because it'll be our first useful website So without taking too much time I'll make a new folder in this sigma web dev folder and I'll name it video4 because it's our fourth video So I'll make it with the name video4 by clicking on shift right and open with code so that the folder opens in our VS code After doing this, I'll do what we always do index.html, main.css, style.css and along with that, script.js We usually make these 3 files If I write css, I'll put it here If I write script, I'll put it here but for now, I'll just write an exclamation mark here and write something like this in the document my bookmarks So we're going to make a bookmark website and I'll write code with that here So you must have seen such titles Now I'll write h1 here Now what happens with h1? You can add headings to your web page with h1 We talked about the basic structure We said that it tells that this is an HTML page html lang is equal to en lang is an attribute and its value is en which means that the content of this page is in English and it tells this to search engines or if anyone is using this web page link then they'll know that this web page is in English and they can parse this web page accordingly the browser will also know that your web page is in English Now here we have a head with metadata which is the title of the page which CSS link is there all these things are information the main content is in the body Now to add headings to the body, there is a tag called h1 and I'm going to write my bookmarks in it So if I write my bookmarks here then we'll write this with h1 tag and if I want to live this here I'll click here and then I'll open it in browser so you can see how my bookmarks are visible Now why should we always use h1? Why didn't I write my bookmarks directly? Because I'm telling the browser that this is my heading and this is my first level heading Now suppose I want to keep two kinds of bookmarks in my bookmarks one is main bookmarks and the other is secondary bookmarks so I'll use h2, which is the heading of the second level so if you've used Microsoft word, you'll know what h1 and h2 are but if you don't know then I'll tell you that h1 is your main level heading and the other level heading is from h2 suppose I say main bookmarks and secondary bookmarks I'll do something like this and I'll press ALT, SHIFT and DOWN arrow I'll do one thing, why didn't I turn on screencast mode? so what I did here is I pressed ALT, SHIFT and DOWN arrow so this is replicated, this is the shortcut of VS Code I want to tell you one more shortcut of VS Code that if you press ALT in your keyboard and then wherever you click, there will be a cursor suppose I click here, then only one cursor will appear but if I click on ALT and if I click on other place, then there will be a cursor suppose I want to make all bookmarks code with Harry so my bookmarks dash code with Harry I can write something like this how did I do this?
